summary:
Notre-Dame de Paris is a famous Catholic cathedral on an island in the River Seine. Its unique Gothic architecture includes colorful windows and creative support structures. The cathedral, built in the 1100s, has a long history, surviving revolutions and inspiring Victor Hugo's novel, *The Hunchback of Notre-Dame*. It has been restored several times, most recently after a fire in 2019.

Known for its beautiful organs and bells, Notre-Dame is a symbol of Paris, attracting millions of visitors. It holds important religious artifacts, like the Crown of Thorns. The cathedral's sermons are famous, often given by notable figures.
title: Notre-Dame de Paris
